result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deandrae L Anderson

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Final status/scheduling conference on December 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial on December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.  (The FSSC and JT have been canceled as they were inadvertently scheduled. LZ)
Continuance Order; cc; DA, Atty Nelson ae 8/31/22
Status conference on September 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

[ma] Case called at 10:57am 
Defendant Deandrae L Anderson in court with Attorney Cassi Nelson.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Mr. Anderson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 11:03am  

NEXT:  Status Conference on 9/6/22 at 3:30pm
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on May 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ml] Case called at 1:18PM
Defendant Deandrae L Anderson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant provides an updated address: 291 Fraternity Ln, Apt 221, Whitewater, WI 53190.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,500.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no physical contact with any minor child, expect for with children that are biologically his
--no unsupervised contact with any minor child, except for with children that are biologically his

recess 1:22PM

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 05/25 at 9:30AM (2) Preliminary Hearing on 06/09 at 9:00AM with in person appearances
